title: Writing About Your Future Plans
description: Write about your plans and goals for the next year.

prompt.topic: My Plans for the Next Year
prompt.description: Write about your plans, goals, and predictions for the next year. Include personal goals (career, education, health, hobbies) and explain why these are important to you. Consider what challenges you might face and how you plan to overcome them.
requirements: Describe at least three goals or plans for the next year
Explain why each goal is important to you
Describe any potential challenges you might face
Explain how you plan to achieve these goals
Use different future forms (will, going to, present continuous)

exampleSentences.sentence: I have several goals I want to achieve in the coming year.
exampleSentences.translation: 다가오는 해에 이루고 싶은 몇 가지 목표가 있어요.

exampleSentences.sentence: My main priority is going to be improving my English skills.
exampleSentences.translation: 제 최우선 과제는 영어 실력을 향상시키는 거예요.

exampleSentences.sentence: I'm planning to start a new exercise routine in January.
This will probably be challenging because I have a busy schedule.
I expect that with hard work, I'll be able to reach my goals.
exampleSentences.translation: 열심히 노력하면 목표를 이룰 수 있을 거라고 기대해요.

exampleSentences.sentence: By the end of the year, I hope to have made significant progress.

vocabularyHelp.example: I want to achieve my career goals.
Learning a new skill is challenging.
I need a better morning routine.
I've made good progress this month.

usefulExpressions.example: I'm planning to learn a new language.

usefulExpressions.usage: To express wishes for the future
usefulExpressions.example: I hope to travel more next year.

usefulExpressions.expression: One of my main goals is...
usefulExpressions.example: One of my main goals is to save more money.
I expect that this will take several months.
The biggest challenge will be finding time.

items: Did you describe at least three goals?
Did you explain why each goal is important?
Did you explain how you'll achieve your goals?
Is your writing focused and relevant?
Did you use 'will' for predictions correctly?
Did you use 'going to' for plans correctly?
Did you use Present Continuous for arrangements?
Did you organize your ideas logically?
Did you use varied vocabulary for plans and goals?
Did you use connecting words effectively?
Is your writing at least 130 words?
Is your writing no more than 180 words?
Does your writing have a clear structure?
Did you complete within the time limit?
